circumstances:
The aircraft left RAF Woolfox Lodge at 1930LT on March 13 on a bombing mission to Germany. Following an uneventful mission and while returning to England, an engine failed. The crew decided to abandon the aircraft and bailed out. Out of control, the bomber dove into the ground and crashed in a field located two miles north of RAF Wittering. The aircraft was destroyed while all seven crew members were unhurt. 
Crew (61st Squadron):
P/O John Ralph Hubbard, pilot,
Sgt P. C. V. Joslin, 
P/O Robert Heggie, observer, 
F/Sgt John George Clelland, wireless operator and air gunner,
Sgt Albert Wallace Baker, wireless operator and air gunner,
Sgt T. C. Stanley,
Sgt P. Jones.
